content.description: Climbs okay, looks like butt. Crux is getting established in the crack; ~10ft of easy crack climbing leads to a large horizontal, and the route finishes straight up a short section of face climbing.
content.protection: Very well protected. Single set of cams to 3" is good. Optional 4" piece for the horizontal near the top.
content.location: Start just right of the ominous protruding rebar and work your way into the obvious, left-most, left leaning crack. Follow this up to a large horizontal, then move straight up on face climbing. Trail access directly from the top of the climb; decent trees for top anchors.

climbs.name: All My Heroes Are Heroin Junkies

content.description: To the right of dirty crack, but still on the main face of the boulder; topo unclear.
content.protection: Solid gear in cracks up to 2".

content.description: This block stands ~30ft tall at its highest point, meaning going ropeless is somewhere in the grey area between bouldering and free soloing. This area sees relatively little climber traffic, which perhaps contributes to the "wild" state of the rock; suspect blocks, dirt and moss abound. The generous amount of soil at the top means that the cracks stay wet several days after a rain.
